Sentencas: This study presents a general framework for modelling heterogeneous electrode reaction mechanisms and reports about their structural properties.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: The procedure proposed is derived from classical systems and control theory.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: Relationships between abstract expressions and measurable electrochemical quantities are established.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: The procedure is illustrated by means of the O(2)(g) reduction at the interface between Pt and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) solid electrolytes.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: Dissociative adsorption of oxygen on the Pt surface, surface diffusion of atomic oxygen, and a two-electron transfer step near the triple phase boundary are considered.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: The. surface concentration of adsorbed atomic oxygen is taken as time dependent state-variable.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: The reaction mechanism is formulated in state-space form and structural investigation of the resulting set of equations is performed on the corresponding transfer function.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: The concept of structural identifiability is demonstrated.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: Expressions describing the steady-state current-voltage behaviour and the frequency response behaviour are derived.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation

Sentencas: It is shown that all unknown parameters can be uniquely estimated from steady-state and impedance measurements.
Titulo: Identification of the reaction mechanism of the Pt, O2(g)|yttria-stabilized zirconia system -: Part I:: General framework, modelling, and structural investigation
